text: hey guys it's Alisa welcome back to my
cupcake addiction on today's episode I'm
showing you how to make an amazing
rainbow checkerboard effect inside your
cake so on the outside it's rather
unassuming and when you cut in it is an
absolute Carnival of color let's get
started I'm cheating a little bit today
with a double batch of a packet mix so
I've just got the ingredients that my
packet says I need to make up my cake
batter I've got some homemade
buttercream frosting and I'll link to my
recipe down below I've gone with packet
cake mix today because we're going to be
adding a fair amount of color and packet
cake mix takes the colour a bit better
you'll need six bowls and a little bit
of nonstick spray I put two circle
cutters I'll leave dimensions for those
just down below in the description box
and I've also got a serrated edge knife
an offset spatula a couple of spoons and
a butter knife you guys need to make six
inch round one inch high layers so I've
got these little kind of weird layer
pans but you could just use a regular
6-inch pan these just saved me a bit of
time I've also got a 12 inch round cake
board just for presentation first up I'm
going to make the whole double batch of
my cake mix because I've got those six
little layer pans if you're using one
pan and baking six layers I'd recommend
making these batches one at a time so
that you don't have one sitting for a
particular long amount of time once
you've added that color when it's all
mixed you want to divide it I'm going to
divide by and into six bowls but if you
just made one batch pop it into three
bowls to begin with and you can decide
how bright or how pastel you want your
colors to be I want really bright so I'm
adding a fair amount of food coloring to
each of those and really making sure
that it's mixed through thoroughly I
popped each of my different coloured
batters into ziplock bags which it makes
life a little bit easier really
generously spray your little baking tins
and then I use the ziplock bag to pipe
in my mixture you can just spoon it in
but the ziplock bags make sure that you
get a really nice even distribution and
you really want a fair amount of batter
because you want to make sure that you
get nice one inch high layers here
flatten them off with the back of a
spoon and then off into the oven they go
they're not going to take the full
amount of cook time mine and they took
about 14 minutes
for these short layers to bake repeat
that with all of your colors and let all
of your layers cool on a wire rack until
they are completely cool they can't even
be a little bit warm here
with layer cakes I like to pop mine into
the freezer for about an hour or so so
they're actually a little bit firm to
work with I find that it stops them from
crumbling when they're really freshly
made so now I'm just taking my serrated
edge knife and I'm just cutting along
sort of three at a time because I really
want these to all be nice even layers
and it's pretty important that they're
all about the same height for our
checkerboard effect to work once you've
cut the tops off them all flip them over
and you can see because of that nonstick
spray you've got a little bit of a brown
bottom so really thinly trim off any
Brown edges any Brown bottom that you
can see there so all you've got is
gorgeous vibrant color once they're all
nicely trimmed you want to take your red
orange and yellow and I stack them on
top of each other and then I'm cutting
around the edges once again just getting
rid of any Brown and making them all
nice and even I've chosen to do my
checkerboard with red orange and yellow
together and then purple green and blue
together for my various layers once
you've got all of your layers ready you
want to take your circle cutters so you
know the dimensions of mine from the
tools and equipment down below but you
may need to adjust this a little bit if
your cakes have come out slightly bigger
or slightly smaller I'm going to cut
first a circle out of the middle and
then a smaller circle out of the middle
of that circle so what you end up with
is sort of two big hollow circles and
one little round middle do that with all
of your different cake layers and then
you're going to take a little bit of
that white buttercream frosting and I
like it if your buttercream frosting is
really nice and bright and white here so
if you're making with butter like I do
add a little bit of white coloring or
icing whitener to it so it's nice and
crisp and white a really thin layer of
that buttercream around the inside edge
of each of those cakes once again great
if there are a little bit frozen here
because it makes them a lot sturdier to
work on now you want to alternate your
colors so that each of your layers has
one of each of the three colors so in
your red outer ring and orange middle
ring and then a yellow center ring and
just switch them around you want to make
sure that you don't end up with two of
the same color in any one of your layers
here the buttercream frosting is going
to help to fill in the gaps and it
also going to stick them together nicely
by the time you finish here you should
have three of those orange red yellow
layers and you should also have three of
your green blue purple layers clean up
your bench get yourself organized and
grab your presentation board you want to
take a nice generous amount of that
buttercream frosting and smear it down
on the board to sort of stick your cake
in place I'm going to start with one of
those blue green layers and down it goes
and then I'm going to put in a nice
relatively even coat but not too thick
of that white buttercream frosting make
sure when your frosting this that your
frosting extends slightly out over the
edges of your cake so you don't have as
many gaps to fill in later you want to
lay your disks of cake kind of opposite
here so if you've got a bluish one then
you want to go with the reddish one then
a bluish one then a reddish one until
you get to the top when you're at the
top then you want to take some of your
buttercream frosting and set it aside
because it's going to get really crummy
here and you just want to give it a
really nice crumb coat so I'm working
with spatula back and forth around the
outside edge of the cake and really
driving that frosting right into any
cracks any crevices you can go up and
down you can go side to side whatever is
easiest for you pop some of that crumb
coat across the top as well and once
you're happy that you've filled in all
of your gaps scrape back off as much of
it as you can pop it off into the
freezer for about 15 minutes it's not
going to freeze the cake it's just going
to set that top layer of frosting and
then you can come back to your lovely
clean non crummy buttercream frosting
and apply another relatively thick coat
here I put a fair bit on because then
we're going to use a ruler to really
smooth it off you can use an offset
spatula but because it's such a tall
cake a ruler works a little bit better
here so you can see I'm just using the
ruler around the outside edges just just
smooth it back beautifully and just drag
the ruler around at once they get your
offset spatula and fill in any spots
where you can see your frosting levels a
little bit low you might need to do this
two or three times but what you'll end
up with is a beautiful smooth side wall
to your gorgeous rainbow checkerboard
cake once you're happy with the edges
take your offset spatula and just make
sure it's clean and sort of drag that
little Reggie bit of frosting from the
top back into the top layer here so you
can see it being really gentle and I'm
wiping my spatula in between so it's
always really nice
you clean I'm a little bit of a
perfectionist so even when I got to this
stage I added a bit more frosting and
smoothed it back again but it's
completely up to you how fussy you want
to be here and you can have a think
about how you're going to decorate the
cake I'm going to leave this one today
plain white because when you actually
take a slice out of your rainbow
checkerboard cake that is what you're
going to see inside it's an absolute
gorgeous carnival of color in there I
love all the little individual cubes if
you guys are looking for some cool ways
to decorate this cake make sure you
check out the my cupcake addiction
youtube channel through literally
hundreds of fabulous ideas there as
always guys thanks very much for tuning
in to my cupcake addiction
